name: The Westin Grand Berlin

reviews.title: Great Hotel Best Location In Berlin
reviews.text: The location of the hotel can't be beat. I thought the staff was great. However they are building a Subway line on two sides of the hotel so call first about that for a room request.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is within walking distance of the Reichstag Tiergarten Museum Island.
reviews.title: It is grand indeed!

reviews.text: Basically it's in the center of Berlin and frankly the action is now in that area.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We chose the Westin Grand Berlin just for one night but a special one since it was New Year's Eve. The first object we saw before entering the hotel was a piece of the Berlin Wall that belongs to the Westin. Check in was fast but if you need information about the city go straight to the Concierge. The lobby is spacious and beautiful. We received a New Year gift from the hotel and it was a very nice touch. We didn't have a view room but we didn't ask for it since we spent most of our time outside. The location is unbeatable! It was easy to do the main sights and some grocery shopping as well as walking at night to Brandenburg gate to watch fireworks. Our overall impression is positive. Thank you for a nice holiday!
reviews.title: Awesome service and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best concierge desk I´ve ever seen. Excellent room. Lobby bar/restaurant is very nice, but menu could offer more variety and service could be more prompt. Beware of rooms facing the side street where subway is being built.
reviews.title: Good central venue - Possibly the most expensive cup of tea in the World

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay here. I was in Berlin for a conference with my colleagues and we all stayed at the Westin. I was lucky to receive an upgraded room which was spacious and renovated. I loved it! My colleagues were placed in smaller and older rooms. Even so, everyone had only great things to say about this hotel. The Westin beds are always a bonus! This hotel is close to everything...great shopping, great food, the subway, and many tourist sightseeing spots. The breakfast buffet was incredible with lots of selections and great coffee! I highly suggest this hotel!
reviews.title: Great location...close to everything

reviews.text: The Westin Grand Berlin is an excellent hotel, and is in a fantastic location for visiting the main attractions. I had high hopes for the hotel being part of the Starwood group, and it did not disappoint. An up-market feel inside and out, and very helpful staff from the first moment we stepped through the door.
reviews.title: Great hotel - ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was good, well furnished but perhaps a little spartan. The beds were outstanding - as many others have said! Despite the extensive building work taking place outside, it was not noisy and did not interrupt our stay. The U-Bahn station right outside the hotel is closed due to the works, but a quick stroll to either Stadtmitte or Friedrichstraße was no problem, and it is very easy to get out to Potsdammer, Alexanderplatz and further a-field from both.
reviews.title: BETTER THAN I EXPECTED

reviews.text: There were only two minor downsides for me, first off the lifts are incredibly slow and seemed to take an age to get to our floor (6th) which isn't a massive gripe, just a tad frustrating waiting around. Also, during our stay there was some filming taking place which really did take over the hotel and some of the individuals taking part in the filming were rude towards myself and other guests which was a bit frustrating considering how friendly the main hotel staff had been.
reviews.title: Berlin With my Parents

reviews.text: I did not partake in the breakfast at the hotel, instead venturing further out into town - the same for the evening meal but the areas for both eating, drinking and wellness seemed comprehensive.
reviews.title: Brilliant location for a few day's stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed on an SPG deal for $50 and got a brand new room (which was superb, wonderful bed too).
reviews.title: Stunning Hotel

likes.liked: — The $50 room & vodka/lime cocktails in the bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only building work going on now is in the pool area (finishing in May) so all the other public areas are clear. The Westin is a stunning hotel, with a really lively upmarket piano bar.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had been warned of a noiseless facelift but was unprepared to battle my way through a foyer of painters and then have to step over debris and rolled up carpets to find the room. Really not worth the money for such a top class hotel. They should have closed for such extensive work and I think it is just greedy to keep it open but treat it's guests as second class citizens. My request to speak to the Manager was ignored as was a letter whilst I was staying there.
reviews.title: Amazing location

reviews.text: Would not return as so much choice in Berlin but can say it's situation is ideal for walking to the sights.
reviews.title: Good location, still adhering to Communist service standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note: The hotel is in the middle of a renovation so all this may change soon.
reviews.title: Impersonal hotel in amaziningly good location

likes.disliked: — small bedrooms until we paid considerably more for an upgrade and 'heavenly beds' they are not

reviews.text: Stayed here for business in late April 2008 and it was a pleasure. The internal architectural structure is beautiful, friendly staff and room was very pleasant.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

likes.liked: — Stunning foyer, great service, central location
likes.disliked: — Pool was under renovation, room view wasn't great

reviews.text: Be warned that the pool is being renovated at present, so you can't use it.
reviews.title: great hotel
Good but not Great
reviews.text: Also, I got a room overlooking some tired concrete roofs - not sure if better views are available upon request...

i stayed at the westin grand for 4 days and it was great.the rooms were big enough and very clean. the hotel staff were really helpful and the breakfast was superb. There is also a spa inside the hotel which was really great and very very clean.I recommend it !!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, recently refurbished

likes.liked: — Newly renovated, close to the shops
likes.disliked: — Other side of town from the airport

reviews.title: Nice hotel, tired rooms
reviews.text: The Westin Grand is a bit of a contradiction. Its location is outstanding, right at Freidrichstrasse next to the fabulous Gallerie Lafayette department store in what used to be East Berlin, walking distance to Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag and Checkpoint Charlie, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know that the hotel is currently undergoing a significant renovation and guests' opinions depend on a type of room they get. We were lucky, got a fresh and new double room on the 3rd floor. We loved the hotel's location and the area. The room was quite large, had a huge, lovely bed and was nicely furnished.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.text: I love this hotel, have stayed here twice. It is in a great spot on the east side of Berlin right in the heart of fabulous shopping and walking distance from some of the sites such as Checkpoint Charlie. Everything is new as it has been totally rennovated, the hotel staff is top class and the restaurant is really good (althoughy fairly American). I look forward to Berlin because of the Westin!
reviews.title: A Slice of Heaven!

reviews.text: I was in Berlin July 2006 (for the worldcup final) and I decided to return because I loved the city. For my first stay I stayed at the Steigenberguer hotel, quite nice, but I didn't love the location so for my second visit I decided to go to the Grand Westin, since Westin had never let me down.
reviews.title: Nice location, but don't expect much

reviews.text: I browsed their site and I saw amazing pictures, great rooms, very modern... an amazing hotel! When I got there, and my room was asigned I was in shock! My room was in the furthest wing from the lobby and it couldn't have been worse, it literally was more than 50 years old, the beds were very stiff, the bathroom was not very clean and it was very disfunctional.
reviews.title: The Benchmark for Berlin

reviews.text: After going through a lot of talking with the managers they changed our room, but it was still quite old (like 30 years) and not much of a 5 stars room.
reviews.title: First class hotel and staff

reviews.text: i was in Westin Grand Berlin 2006 christmas with my couisen.
reviews.title: Christmas Holiday in Westin Grand Berlin

reviews.text: it was really nice experience for me.Hotel is located in city center.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: The only problem is there is no sits on the beakfast and somtimes you sould wait to get a breakfast.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

reviews.text: Wonderful Hotel, Great rooms, Stunning Hotel Lobby (although a bit pricey, if you are just after a coffee), Great Pool and location. Berlin is fantastic at christmas time, The hotel is a short walk from the wonderful christmas markets.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: Top Class hotel in Berlin. Only 20 minutes from the airport, about a 20 euro cab ride. From the moment you enter the hotel, all of the staff are very helpful and friendly. The main entrance is very beautiful with a large open area bar. The room was totally updated clean and modern. This hotel is in a very central location to all attractions in Berlin. The breakfast buffet although very good was a little pricey at 28 euros per person. There is a nice restaurant around the corner on the main street which was very good at 38 euros for a family of four versus, 112 euros. Very beautiful and historical city worth visiting!
reviews.title: Impressing hotel

reviews.text: This is a pretty hotel in a very good location to see 'museum island, the Brandenburg Gate & the remains of the wall. We were given wrong information from the concierge about which museums are opened on which days & which synogagues where working synogagues & which were still open. We were only in Berlin for 2 days so this miss information costs us a lot of time. We were not allowed to check in early (our plane landed at 9:00, we got to the hotel by 10:10 & they wouldn't let us check in before 3). When we asked to speak to the manager, she told us that 'yes' our designated room was empty & available, however, if we wanted to check in before 3:00 we would have to pay for an entire extra day. With that she said good-bye, turned around and walked away. We could not leave our luggage & go out because there is no designated room for nit-it is left in the lobby by the concierge, who has chores all over the hotel and leaves the desk very often for long periods of time. The same happened when we asked to be able to leave our things someplace the day we were leaving because we had 4 hours to spare. When we returned home we complained to the home office about the policy & the attitude of the manager-we were told that each hotel runs their hotel separately & that they have no control over them.
reviews.title: NASTY MANAGEMENT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great buffet breakfast & reasonable for Berlin.
reviews.title: Within walking distance from Berlin attractions

reviews.text: This 5* hotel is excellent location for those who want to explore berlin: amongst several shopping centres, within walking distance from major Berlin attractions (incl the famous Museum island) and 2 mins walks from Alex platz!
reviews.title: Unmatched Location, Discreet Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But 1 week is not enough to explore Berlin. Will definitely stay in this hotel again the next time i'm in Berlin.
reviews.title: Fantastic location. Excellent hotel.

reviews.text: Just nipped down to Berlin for the weekend. As befitting a grand hotel, the welcome was first class and the location unbeatable. The junior suite was tastefully furnished, but the sleeping area was a little bit cramped due to the over-sized wardrobe. Really enjoyed the art exhibition in the lobby.
reviews.title: Great hotel for business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the WGB for four nights over the Easter weekend and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. I am surprised at previous comments on Tripadvisor about the lack of warmth from the reception staff - without exception we found everyone at the hotel to be very friendly, helpful and courteous. The concierge service was particularly good and we benefited greatly from their advice on dinner choices (Il Punto Italian restaurant 5 mins walk away was superb) and travel arrangements. The atmosphere in the lobby bar during the evenings was very nice and we enjoyed a drink there each evening at the end of a long day's sightseeing. Okay, the drinks weren't the cheapest but we were in a top hotel in a capital city so it came as no great shock to us and certainly didn't put us off popping in there every evening!
reviews.title: Excellent Location Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of location, the WGB is ideal for access to all the main sights, shops and transport systems with many within easy walking distance. We took a 5 hour walking tour of the city on our first morning in Berlin (Original Berlin Walks - excellent and thoroughly recommended for first time visitors to Berlin like us) and found that once we had our bearings, the hotel was ideally located for what we wanted to see and do. Friedrichstrasse S-Bahn station is only a five minute walk away and made for a really easy day trip to Potsdam during our stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negatives about the WGB? We were very happy with our stay but there were a couple of minor issues worthy of mention. Firstly, breakfast. We booked room only on the basis of previous comments on TA about the high cost (32 Euros per person) and the limited choices at breakfast. Instead we chose to visit the nearby Einstein Cafe where we enjoyed an excellent and substantial breakfast for less than 30 Euros for the two of us in a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere. Secondly, the Wi-Fi charges were way too high for us even to bother whilst in the hotel, particularly when there is a Starbucks cafe next to the Friedrichstrasse S-Bahn station where you can get free Wi-Fi while you enjoy your coffee and muffin! These were minor issues though and caused us no problems so would in no way prevent us from returning to the WGB on our next trip to Berlin, as the many positives far outweighed the minor niggles.
reviews.title: lovely hotel- ouch on the wifi charge!

reviews.text: Stayed as usual for Christmas at the Westin in Berlin. Had the Grand Spa Suite, which is beautiful, very lovely modern decor and spa bathroom. Staff great as always. Love the breakfast buffet in the mornings- great choice. Looking forward to coming back in May this year.
reviews.title: Nice location for Old Berlin

reviews.text: excellent locations, really friendly staff and well appointed rooms but two big issues: 7.50 euro for one hour of wifi is outrageous! and my other issue: 6 euro for a cup of coffee - maybe I am being mean in my old age but they are two things I benchmark all hotels against and the Westin Berlin comes out wanting on both. Reason for 4 stars is that the staff are excellent, very friendly and helpful - so would recommend for accommodation but go to Starbucks down the road for free wifi and cheaper coffee!
reviews.title: Could be Grand

description: Famous location in the historic city centre, trendy district "Berlin-Mitte", on the corner "Unter den Linden"/ "Friedrichstrasse" and very well connected to all public transportation.Sights like Brandenburger Tor, Checkpoint Charlie, Museumsinsel and Gendarmenmarkt within walking distance400 elegant rooms and suites, lavish lobby with grand staircase, restaurant, bar, summer terrace, spacious hotel garden, spa "glow spa & beauty", fitness area, business center, 11 function roomsHave a little relaxation and stay well!
